BeanShell Commands
Adding Commands to BeanShell
Adding to the set of "prefab" commands supplied with bsh can be about as easy as writing any other bsh methods. You simply have to place your bsh scripts in a bsh/commands/ directory in the classpath (or inside the JAR file).
You can also implement bsh commands directly in Java as .class files which are dynamically loaded when needed. The dir() commands are an example of a bsh command that is implemented in Java. (I did this originaly for speed).
